alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Hillsborough, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and runoff is expected to continue for a couple of hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Derry, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Salem, Dover, Somersworth and Barrington.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
